author: Darek Link

text:
Love the VGM list. :)

I couldn't make one of these so diversified, 90% of the music would be SMRPG, FF3/Tactics, Knights in the Nightmare, Suikoden and some Etrian Odyssey Untold 2, haha.

So hats off to you for being objective.. xD

text: Cheerful tune, this game really set a lot of the right moods. The only thing I didn't like about this game was the Yoshi races. I just could never get the rhythm right.

author: Red Kopler

text: 5 houses and a castle, it's all that's needed for this Kingdom. It reflects the whole game pretty well and its great pace, you rarely feel like it's wasting your time doing useless things. A short and sweet ride, but still with a great variety of worlds and gameplay elements. It's the same kind of feeling I get from other classics like Chrono Trigger.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky No surprise it reminded you of Chrono Trigger; square did do most of the development!
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: SMRPG is one of the most fun, relaxing, upbeat and generally enjoyable JRPGs I ever played.
